meanings.definition: A person who manages or controls every part of a project or task in a detailed and excessive way.
meanings.sent1: The micromanager in our group always wants to know every little detail.
meanings.sent2: The team found it challenging to work under the micromanager's constant supervision.
meanings.sent3: The micromanager insisted on approving every pencil purchase for the office.
meanings.sent4: Being a micromanager is like trying to paint a masterpiece with a single hairbrush.
meanings.sent5: The image of the micromanager meticulously arranging each paperclip stuck in everyone's mind.

meanings.definition: To manage or control every part of a project or task in a detailed and excessive way.
meanings.sent1: She tends to micromanage every aspect of her team's work.
meanings.sent2: It is not effective to micromanage every step of the process.
meanings.sent3: He decided to micromanage the family picnic, causing chaos instead of order.
meanings.sent4: Micromanaging the situation only led to frustration and delays.
meanings.sent5: The urge to micromanage can hinder creativity and innovation within a team.
